page.title: 14DALRY AGRICULTURAL SHOW
page.content: The Show, on May 18th, was busy, with many animals, competitors, and visitors. The horse and pony events consisted of jumping, games, showing Clydesdales, and a driving turnout class. Classes of cows, bulls,and calves of every breed were judged. In the pets class, old sheepdogs, hamsters, goldfish and greyhounds were among the entries. There were a lot of sheep on the showfield, including Border Leicester, Suffolk and Blackface breeds. The Highland dancers, aged 4 to 15, were very popular.The boys and girls danced to pipe band music. The "industrial" tent was filled with baking, home-made jams, floral arrangements, knitted and sewn articles and children's exhibits of best dressed vegetables and flowers in egg cups. A lot of hard work was done to make a very successful Show.
